search_results.title: October (U2 album) - Wikipedia

search_results.snippet: October is the second studio album by Irish rock band U2. It was produced by Steve Lillywhite, and released on 12 October 1981 on Island Records. Inspired by Bono's, the Edge's, and Larry Mullen Jr.'s memberships in a Christian group called the "Shalom Fellowship", the record features spiritual and religious themes.
search_results.title: October (U2 album) - Wikipedia

search_results.snippet: Island Records signed U2 in March 1980, and in May the band released "11 O'Clock Tick Tock" as their first international single. Their debut album, Boy, followed in October. Produced by Steve Lillywhite, it received generally positive reviews.
